name: Pictionary: The Game of Quick Draw
description:
Based on the board game, the object is guess a word or phrase based on a drawing. There are five categories - Person/Place/Animal, Object, Action, a category of difficult puzzles, and an All Play category. The amount of time to guess an answer can be altered.

These drawings are done using a cut-down variant of a paint package, which you can practice with to get your drawing skills up to scratch. You are not limited to freehand drawing - lines, boxes, circles and curves can be drawn, with variable ink colours and line thickness. After each question the game will tell you the answer and ask which player (if any) got the correct answer. Pictionary can be played against the computer, or with multiple players.
alsoFor: Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, DOS | Combined View

shot.caption: This screen displays as the game loads
Then the game does a bit more loading. Across the top are options. Game sets how many players there are, Level sets how long the player(s) have to guess
The action keys cannot be redefined, however the important keys are displayed, this can also be displayed via the Help / Keys menu
Some more instructions, still not sure what is going on. This can also be displayed via the Help / Help menu
The game starts and the computer begins to draw. The countdown timer shows that there is a minute to guess what this is going to be

Eighteen seconds to draw a square! 
Seems like the computer's time-wasting
From this its obvious that the answer is a cafe or restaurant. Now what were those keys again?
At 15 seconds the player hit the space bar in desperation because the action keys did not seem to help
The game responds by giving the answer and asking if the player got it right. Well he had two words in mind and one was the right answer so the response is Yes
That 'Well Done' was deserved. To continue the game the player(s) must point the cursor at the 'Continue game' box and press 'Fire', alternatively the 'C' action key also does the job
The game continues, a dice is rolled, and in order to repeat the cycle the player must use the arrow keys to point to the stack of question cards, the brick like thing in the top right
The computer draws another picture, then another etc until the game is complete
Game options : number of players / teams
Game Options : in a multiplayer game the players get the chance to draw a picture using the game. This is also the control that loads an alternate block of questions
The Help option shows the current score, copyright information
